title: Tony Abbott vows to fight Liberal leadership spill motion â live | Australia news | The Guardian
summary: malcolm turnbull would give coalition an election winning lead .
government whip : leadership the only item on the partyroom agenda .
andrew robb : it will make us look like a bit of a circus frankly .
julie bishop promised that she would not vote for a spill on procedural grounds .
julie bishop statement : there should be support for the current leadership in this spill motion .

documents.title: tony abbott to oppose a spill motion on his leadership
text: here is what we know from today 's events : the prime minister will oppose a spill motion , to be put to the partyroom on tuesday .
no other contenders have yet thrown their hat in the ring , including malcolm turnbull and julie bishop .
tony abbott will continue with scheduled events over the weekend .
parliament sits on monday .
a newspoll is expected on monday .
most ministers have come out to support abbott .
however we have yet to hear from notable exceptions ; turnbull , bishop , christopher pyne , scott morrison and greg hunt , among others .
thanks for your support and lively conversation .
katharine murphy will smash the blog out of the park on monday so join her then .
goodnight .
ian macfarlane says it 's a small rump of dissenters and the government needs to just put it behind them .
to my knowledge there is a handful , maybe 10 or 15 people at the bottom of all of this out of a party room of over 100 .
the support for tony abbott in the cabinet is unanimous and we just need to get this behind us and get on with the job .
ian macfarlane basically outlines the ministerial position on the spill motion .
it reflects every minister 's comments that we have seen so far .
the talking point .

we acknowledge that there have been mistakes made in the past and we 're all about getting on with the job , and this year was meant to be a fresh start and a more focussed and more consultative government and this distraction is only delaying us from that .
industry ministers ian macfarlane says the cabinet is unanimous in support of tony abbott .
i 'll be voting against the spill motion .
australia does n't need this , the coalition obviously does n't need it .
we need to get on with business , we need to be making sure that we 're providing the sort of legislative change that keeps our economy strong and keeps jobs growing in australia .
this is a distraction no one wants and no one needs .
alan tudge , parliamentary secretary to the prime minister , is urging his colleagues against a spill .
i do n't think the spill motion will get up .
at the moment there 's two people who have said publicly that they 're supporting it and only two out of 102 members of parliament .
so i do n't see the spill motion succeeding .
rob harris ( @ rharris334 ) parli sec for finance @ twitterid mccormackmp now going to g20 business leader summit in istanbul .
hockey & frydenberg staying for party room vote .
former wa treasurer christian porter is supporting abbott and will ask luke simpkin to withdraw the spill motion .
i support the pm and i do n't support the spill motion , there 's nothing unequivocal about either of those statements .
labor mp ed husic has been particularly cruel .
ed husic ( @ edhusicmp ) breaking : chief govt whip reveals inanimate carbon rod to contest # libspill
simpkins and randall .
a folk band ?
a suburban law firm ?
a brand of soap ?
the two west australian backbenchers who could be responsible for tony abbott 's downfall have a colourful history .
shalailah medhora reports .
julie bishop was due to attend a fundraising function in malcolm turnbull 's electorate on sunday in a private home in bellevue hill .
laurie oakes has reported the prime minister 's office asked bishop not to attend .
oakes said she refused their request .

documents.title: malcolm turnbull would give coalition an election winning lead
text: lenore taylor reports : under malcolm turnbull the coalition would catapult from an election losing position in the polls to a decisive election-winning lead , according to a new opinion poll that lands as coalition mps deliberate on how to vote in tuesday 's dramatic leadership spill motion .
the seven news-reachtel poll confirmed the coalition 's current dire position under tony abbott 's leadership - with 45 % to 55 % of the two party preferred vote .
but when it asked how people would vote if malcolm turnbull were prime minister , the coalition 's position reversed and it lead labor by 54 % to 46 % of the two party preferred vote .
julie bishop , the other possible candidate in tuesday 's ballot would also put the coalition ahead of labor if she were prime minister , but by a smaller margin - 51 % to 49 % .
when forced to choose between malcolm turnbull and julie bishop as liberal leader , 56.5 % preferred turnbull and 43.5 % bishop .
neither julie bishop nor malcolm turnbull have declared whether they will stand if the spill motion to be moved by two west australian mps succeed .
the prime minister and his backers are working frantically to ensure the spill motion does not get up .
of the 3,503 voters polled by telephone last night 62.7 % said they thought tony abbott was doing a poor , or a very poor job as prime minister .
39.3 % thought bill shorten was doing a poor or very poor job .
immigration minister peter dutton has also been out with some points .
the spill should be opposed .
we 've got some things wrong and i think the pm has been gutsy in admitting that .
i think the pm should be given a fair go to demonstrate the government 's ability to clean up labor 's mess .
it 's only been a couple of days since he gave that press club speech .
he 's not been given one news cycle of clear air .
julie has said she 'll support the pm .
i see a strong leader , a decisive leader .
trade minister andrew robb made mention of an orchestrated campaign .
immigration minister peter dutton says the prime minister has not been given one news cycle of free air .
here is how the week panned out for tony abbott .
the key here is the critical comments were usually in the morning and in the evening around critical media deadlines .

queensland election , saturday night , january 31 queensland liberal jane prentice , reeling from the election results , refused to endorse tony abbott 's continued leadership and said the press club speech would be a make or break moment .
monday february 2 12.30-1.35pm : abbott gives his national press club address .
3.35pm : queensland backbencher andrew laming releases a statement announcing that he will put forward a private members ' bill to abolish the knights and dames honours system .
the motion was backed by former whip warren entsch later that day .
tuesday february 3 peter costello uses a column in the daily telegraph to warn if the government does not change , the public will forcibly change it .
7.30pm : west australian mp dennis jensen tells the 7.30 report the party can no longer continue with abbott at the helm , saying he has informed the pm that he no longer has his support .
8pm : in a televised speech , queensland mp and former howard government minister mal brough announces that abbott no longer has his unconditional support , citing medicare and defence pay .
reports emerge that entsch has also withdrawn his support for abbott and wants the matter resolved at the first party room .
wednesday february 4 8am : former victorian premier and liberal powerbroker jeff kennett describes tony abbott 's leadership as terminal on abc radio .
queensland mp teresa gambaro writes in the australian that a leader should not lie - to their colleagues or the australian people .
5pm : former assistant treasurer arthur sinodinos tells sky news that his support for abbott is not unconditional .
when asked if abbott will remain prime minister , he said ask me next week .

thursday february 5 5pm : andrew robb acknowledges that the government surprised the voters ( broke promises ) with the budget , including controversial policies like the medicare copayment and university deregulation .
but he says the fact is that if something happened on tuesday which led to a spill we would be seen as a bunch of amateurs .
5.30pm : michael kroger acknowledges tony abbott has difficulties : everyone in the country knows that ¦ as to who leads the party , tony is the leader .
if that 's going to be changed , you 'll all be notified .
friday february 6 6.30am : asked about tony abbott 's support , christopher pyne says of the numbers , they are an inexact science and that he hopes tony abbott has the support .
1.30pm : luke simpkins announces he will move a spill motion .
which does not leave many news cycles left in the week .

documents.title: government whip : leadership the only item on the partyroom agenda
text: phillip ruddock , the government whip says the spill motion will be the only item on the partyroom agenda on tuesday .
simply , two members have written to me and indicated that they wish a motion listed for discussion and after discussion by me with the pm he has agreed that we will deal with it on tuesday .
and that is all i have to say .
q : would you support the motion ?
( in voting ) i keep my counsel .
i do n't believe it is appropriate given the position i hold and working with the leader as i do , that i should be a commentator .
q : it will be a secret ballot ?
the party has no written rules , i 've said this before .
the fact that we have no written rules , means that people are guided by convention and practice .
it 's really a matter for the leader to determine .
on the last occasion , malcolm turnbull when he was the subject of a motion asked john howard for some counsel as to how it should proceed .
john said as i recall , it can be a show of hands .
malcolm determined that it would be a secret ballot .
it 's a matter for the party to determine at the appropriate time .
it 's important to note that turnbull has not confirmed he is a candidate .
but if he is , will tony abbott extend the same courtesy of a secret ballot to turnbull as turnbull did to abbott ?
josh barro ( @ jbarro ) in the future , everyone will be prime minister of australia for 15 minutes .
former liberal member and abbott mate ross cameron advocates change , though he does not have a vote .
he quotes shakespeare : if it were done when tis done , then twere well it were done quickly .
macbeth has to be instructive .

documents.title: ministers in support of abbott
text: the ministers who have thus far come out in support of tony abbott are : josh frydenberg bruce billson mathias cormann jamie briggs kevin andrews eric abetz andrew robb , kind of , given that he did not say he would vote against the spill motion .
everyone apart from robb urged colleagues not to vote for the spill motion .
robb criticised it , but did not specifically state he would vote against it .
the man that lit the fuse , luke simpkins says : if ( abbott 's ) not being listened to , he ca n't lead i think to state the obvious , i would imagine that malcolm turnbull will put his hand up .

i also hope that julie bishop will put her hand up as well , and maybe scott morrison as well , particularly people that have achieved in their portfolio areas , and also seek to make sure this country remains on the right path .
bruce billson says on julie bishop : i do n't know what else you would expect the deputy to say .
there is so much analysis
i missed the kevin andrews ' key quote !
i believe the team of tony abbott and julia gillard is the best leadership team for the liberal party and therefore part of the best leadership team of the coalition for the country .
# julieandjulia

documents.title: andrew robb : it will make us look like a bit of a circus frankly
text: trade minister andrew robb has been door-stopped at a function .
i think it 's totally unnecessary and it will make us look like a bit of a circus frankly .
i mean , 10 days ago people did n't realise we had a leadership issue and here we are calling a spill .

i do feel that the prime minister deserves some breathing space to show that he 's listened to the criticisms and the concerns which in many cases are legitimate issues , mistakes that have been made .
he should be given the opportunity to demonstrate that he 's absorbed that .
he has led us for five years .
he won an election for us .
he has delivered really substantial achievements last year , remarkable achievements for a first term government but they were overshadowed somewhat by some of the mistakes that we made .
he deserves the opportunity and to look in a panicked way to be bringing on the spill i think , is most unfortunate .
robb is asked : is there any chance of it getting up ?
i 've got no idea .
it looks a little bit orchestrated to me to be honest .
it 's being played out as something that 's just emerged but it looks like it 's been in the can for sometime .
q : who are you pointing the finger at for orchestrating ?
i do n't know i 'm just saying it looks some orchestrated .

documents.title: julie bishop promised that she would not vote for a spill on procedural grounds
text: liberal sources say that julie bishop 's promise to the pm was that she would not vote for a spill because technically it is also a spill of her position .
they suggest she may have been verballed by the prime minister .
kevin andrews is asked do you have a view as to whether it should be a secret ballot or show of hands ?
i know there has been apparently - and this is convention in the party -different approaches taken over the years .
i understand at one stage mr howard advised it could be done by a show of hands .
that is a matter for the whip to determine , no doubt in conjunction with the leadership of the party .
this is an important point .
my prediction , based on nothing but gut instinct and watching tony abbott , is that he will go for a show of hands .
he would want to force members to say to his face - they do not support him .
if you are a minister , are you going to put a hand up ?
defence minister kevin andrews and abbott loyalist says he will vote against spill motion .
key messages : he urges all colleagues to vote against the motion .
it will lead to stability to vote against the motion .
abbott and bishop were voted in by the australian people .
we have a good team .
stability differentiates us from labor .
important point : kevin andrews would probably not survive in a different cabinet .
kevin andrews ( @ kevinandrewsmp ) i 'll be supporting @ twitterid and @ twitterid .
doorstop shortly .
mathias cormann says a vote against the spill motion is a vote in support of tony abbott .

documents.title: julie bishop statement : there should be support for the current leadership in this spill motion
text: julie bishop 's position here is most interesting .
her office says she is not making any statements .
ross cameron , who is close to abbott , made the point on sky he would like to hear from bishop herself .
the twee tweets yesterday between malcolm turnbull and julie bishop - as well as some of the earlier events in the week - suggested a distance between bishop and abbott .
some are suggesting that julie bishop has to stand firm and recommend against the spill motion because she is in the deputy 's position already .
a vote for a spill motion is effectively a move against her .
sky has just announced a statement by julie bishop : due to cabinet solidarity and her position as deputy there should be support for the current leadership in this spill motion .
andrew nikolic again : nothing justifies bringing in a sixth prime minister in the last eight years .
it 's the sort of instability , it 's the sort of lack of unity of effort that i think you find in small african and south american countries and the people explicitly repudiated that in 2013 .
let 's go back to the things that matter most to australia and not focus on ourselves like the labor party did .

documents.title: mathias cormann supporting tony abbott
text: mathias cormann is supporting tony abbott and julie bishop .
he urged all other colleagues to support them .
that is - vote no to the spill motion .

bruce billson , small business minister : frank keany ( @ redneckninja ) billson promises he will vote for tony abbott @ 3aw693 abbott loyalist and defence minister kevin andrews is making a statement at 4.15pm .
tasmanian liberal andrew nikolic : i think my overwhelming feeling is one of disappointment .
i think through this action we 're repeating the sort of behaviours that the australian people explicitly repudiated at the 2013 election .

documents.title: josh frydenberg supports tony abbott
text: assistant treasurer josh frydenberg believes the spill motion will be defeated .
if we change , it will be like buying ticket to a bad labor movie .
there is strong support for the prime minister and his deputy leader it does n't make sense to go down this path .
remember this is what julie bishop said just before midday .
i do n't have advice to my colleagues because they are elected members of parliament and they will take whatever action they see fit , but my overall message is this : we are a united team
my friendly tweep expresses it best .
the matt hatter ( @ mattglassdarkly ) @ gabriellechan err did that just happen ?
what what ?
# politicslive
just so you know - no one knows what is happening .
his statement has blindsided everyone .

documents.title: tony abbott statement
text: here is the full text of tony abbott : as you know , two of my colleagues have called for a leadership spill of the two senior positions in our party .
they 've called for a spill of my position as leader and they 've called for a spill of julie bishop 's position as deputy .

the first point to make is that they are perfectly entitled to call for this , but the next point to make is that they are asking the partyroom to vote out the people that the electorate voted in , in september 2013 .
i want to make this very simple point .
we are not the labor party .

we are not the labor party and we are not going to repeat the chaos and the instability of the labor years , so i have spoken to deputy leader julie bishop and we will stand together in urging the partyroom to defeat this particular motion and in so doing , and in defeating this motion , to vote in favour of the stability and the team that the people voted for at the election .
we have a strong plan .
it 's the strong plan that i enunciated at the press club this week and we are determined to get on with it , and we will .
former liberal mp ross cameron is on sky .
cameron is close to tony abbott .
there are conservative hearts breaking all around the country .
we have certainly done damage to our cause .
the forces arrayed against abbott are massive and his chances at the next election are bad , says cameron .
so luke simpkin , a wa member - most likely a bishop supporter - has called for a spill motion and julie bishop has joined with tony abbott and decided not to allow a spill motion .
tony abbott has repeated the sentiment from his press club address .
it is not for the party room to remove the leader .
tony abbott took no questions .
that 's it .
he 's gone .
so the leadership will stand together to oppose the spill motion .

documents.title: abbott and bishop will stand together to oppose spill motion .
text: we are not going to repeat the labor government .
abbott and bishop will stand together to urge the party not to accept the motion .
abbott on now .
two colleagues have called for a spill .
they are perfectly entitled to call for this .
they are asking the partyroom to vote out the people the voters elected .
more labor reaction .
tim watts ( @ timwattsmp )
to recap on the appearance of spill motion author , luke simpkins , he made it clear that he would prefer julie bishop or scott morrison over malcolm turnbull .
simpkins pointedly made it clear the last time the liberals were in such disarray was when turnbull was pushing the party to accept kevin rudd 's emissions trading scheme .
morrison has made it clear through colleagues he will not run .
luke simpkins is hoping in 20 minutes tony abbott will accept the spill motion .
simpkins wo n't name who he wants as leader , he just hopes to have a successful spill motion so that the issue can be resolved .
i am a man with no frontbench ambitions .
he is doing it for the country and so those economic vandals in labor do n't get back in .
can you support malcolm turnbull as leader ?
luke simpkins says although he has common ground with abbott , people are not listening to him anymore .
luke simpkins is explaining his actions .
his constituents tell him they have no faith in tony abbott .
people want to have the spill because whatever they believe in , they want to endorse the prime minister or not .
i serve the interests of the people of my electorate and i believe i am doing the right thing by them and the country .
the people i know are on my side no longer feel connected with the prime minister .
there is a disconnect , they do n't know what his plan for the future is , they do n't know what he wants to achieve .
simpkins says it has not been coordinated by arthur sinodinos .
except he spoke to sinodinos yesterday .
but he - simpkins - only expressed how he was feeling .
shalailah medhora has been digging on don - the seconder .

she says : seconder of the spill motion , don randall , was at the centre of an expenses scandal in 2013 when it was revealed he used more than $ 5000 of taxpayers ' money to fly to cairns , where he later bought a property .
he reimbursed the money to alleviate ambiguity on the matter .
randall also labelled the gillard government 's crackdown on 457 's racist .

documents.title: abbott speaks
text: the prime minister tony abbott will speak on the spill motion at 3.20pm today in sydney .
the nationals is not happy .
there they were , standing at the front of the church , and here comes a different bride waltzing down the aisle .
( and we thought the nats were against gay marriage . )
here he is in the northern daily leader .
member for new england barnaby joyce has warned the nationals may walk away from the coalition in the wake of an upcoming spill next tuesday .
news of the spill broke this afternoon when western australian liberal mp luke simpkins confirmed he will seek a leadership spill against prime minister tony abbott .
what i say to my colleagues in the liberal party is this : we did n't want this .
we gave you fair warning , mr joyce told the leader .
do not consider that the national party support is without question .
if all of a sudden a different person is walking down the aisle towards us , do n't necessarily think the wedding is still on .
labor was quick off the mark .
australian labor ( @ australianlabor ) whoever 's the leader , the liberals ' policies remain the same .
rt & send them all a message .
# libspill # auspol bill shorten was preparing his lines against other leaders this morning .
i would say they would be getting their election material sorted as well .
here , we must go back to the words of christopher pyne about the counting of numbers being an inexact science .
the other point to note is that a weekend is a very long time .
david speers of sky is also reporting that a minister close to tony abbott believes he has the numbers to hang on to the prime ministership .
sky is reporting that scott morrison is not in the race - from unnamed sources .
former long time senator judith troeth has been highly critical of tony abbott 's leadership on sky news .
she says she knows a lot of backbenchers were not happy with his monday reset speech at the national press club .
troeth , who being a moderate is not a natural ally , said there was still no definition or clarity from abbott as to : what he wants to be and do as prime minister .
sportingbet has malcolm turnbull odds-on at $ 1.50 to lead the coalition at the next election .
tony abbott 's odds of still being prime minister at the next election have drifted significantly from $ 1.10 to $ 2.75 .
julie bishop is third favourite at $ 3.75 .

prime minister at the next election malcolm turnbull $ 1.50 tony abbott $ 2.75 julie bishop $ 3.75 scott morrison $ 15 joe hockey $ 34 christopher pyne $ 41 mal brough $ 51 greg hunt $ 67 barnaby joyce $ 81 andrew robb $ 101 peter dutton $ 101 warren truss $ 251 remember that joyce and truss are not even in the liberal party room .
though the there has been a fair bit of malmentum this week , it would be unwise to suggest that julie bishop is out of the race .
malcolm turnbull 's office is not commenting either .
julie bishop 's office says she is not commenting or doing any other media today .
here is daniel hurst 's story on the motion for a spill in the liberal party room .
tony eastley asked jeff kennett , is it fair to say that mr abbott is the prime architect of his woes here ?
well , that can be an interpretation .

he 's a man of very good values , he 's worked very hard , but there is no doubt that there have been some communication issues and importantly there has been trouble in getting the budget through , partly because of style , partly because of substance and unfortunately in this day and age leadership has to accept responsibility for your success or otherwise .
now , this to me is n't a poll-driven issue - in other words , what the polls are saying - this is more about our ability to be able to deliver consistent and good government .
victorian premier jeff kennett was quick off the blocks .
am i surprised ?
i guess not , in the sense that once these issues start to fester they are like a boil and they need to be lanced and they need to be lanced oneway or the other .
so i think this is the most sensible outcome in trying to resolve the issue quickly next tuesday and i hope the party does that whatever they decide .
more on luke simpkins , again from the west australian .

federal liberal mp luke simpkins has become the target of social media scorn after a high-level intervention to ensure islamic ' stickers were removed from the leederville train station pedestrian overpass .
in a bizarre case of mistaken identity , the stickers were in fact spruiking a local nightclub a fact lost on mr simpkins when he boasted on his facebook page of having them painted over .

tasmanian liberal mp andrew nikolic , who upbraided his colleague andrew laming for not giving tony abbott a break after the monday press club , has again sent out a missive - cc'ed to all of his colleagues .
luke , your actions are disappointing and divisive .
in my view you are repeating the ill-disciplined and self-interested behaviours that the australian people explicitly rejected in 2013 .
you do not have my support for this .
i will be arguing strongly against your motion and in support of what i believe is a clear majority of colleagues and constituents who prefer stability and unity of purpose .
andrew nikolic
chief whip phillip ruddock confirms the spill motion has been received and the motion will go to the party room on tuesday .
this is the regular liberal party room meeting and the first one of the year .
jane norman ( @ janeenorman ) chief whip phillip ruddock confirms he 's received the notice of motion :
who is luke simpkins ?
here is part of a story by nick butterly at the western australian in 2011 .
a wa liberal mp has claimed australians are unknowingly being converted to islam by eating halal meat .
in a speech to parliament yesterday , backbencher luke simpkins said most australians did not know that most of the meat they ate came from animals killed in accordance with muslim law .

by having australians unwittingly eating halal food we are all one step down the path towards the conversion , and that is a step we should only make with full knowledge and one that should not be imposed upon us without us knowing , mr simpkins told parliament .
what is happening is wrong .
too often the minorities in this country are looked after without regard to the majority .

documents.title: the party room vote process
text: to recap on the process : 1 .
a motion for a spill is put to the party room by luke simpkins , seconded by don randall .
the liberal leader , tony abbott , has discretion and if the numbers are small , he can knock it on the head .
if the motion for spill goes to a vote and it wins , only then : 4 .
the party room votes for the leader .
just to clarify , thanks to a well-informed friend of the blog , the move will bring on a motion for a spill .
if the motion for the spill does not win support in the party room , there will be no leadership vote .
sorry to yell at you .
there has been talk of simpkins blowing up the issue for days .
the wa backbencher move will be reportedly seconded by another wa liberal , don randall .
these are two very conservative western australia mps .
which sounds like julie bishop supporters more than turnbull types .
from latika bourke at fairfax , luke simpkin 's email to his colleagues .
latika bourke ( @ latikambourke ) email from luke simpkins to colleagues calling on a spill .
# libspill
lucy barbour ( @ lucybarbour ) breaking : # libspill motion was seconded by don randall mp .
the # libspill is on .
lucy barbour ( @ lucybarbour ) wa liberal mp luke simkins has emailed partyroom colleagues , announcing he will move a spill motion against the prime minister .
# libspill
meanwhile malcolm turnbull is hanging out with marise payne , the minister for human services .
drop into mygov .
marise payne ( @ marisepayne ) good drop in to mygov syd @ twitterid w @ twitterid visit to use our app bar , online access , brochure board
just to freak you out .
the bald archies .
siobhan heanue ( @ siobhanheanue ) there are some truly terrifying entries in this year 's bald archies .
lambie a favourite subject # auspol
one last thing on the alan jones interview .
shalailah medhora and michael safi have compiled a little quiz , in which you have to work out who said what - tony abbott or alan jones .
have a go , y ' mugs .
i only got 9 out of 12 and i have been poring over the interview .
re the sunnies in post 12.25pm !
sunnygate !
hamish collings-begg ( @ hamish cb ) @ gabriellechan they 're photoshopped on .
clearly photoshopped on !
just one more from question from the jones interview .
jones : and before you go , i 've known you for a thousand years , you 're hopeless at talking about yourself , and it 's clear that a lot of people do n't really know their prime minister .
just say something we 're going to 77 stations to tell them : who is tony abbott ?
tell them something about tony abbott .
he 's in the headlines every day who 's the real tony abbott ?
tony abbott : well , i 've always been a bit reluctant to blow my own trumpet , alan , and i like to think that the facts speak for themselves .
i 'm the father of three daughters , i 'm the brother of three sisters , i love my community which i try to serve as a volunteer firefighter and as a surf lifesaver .
obviously , i like sport and try to get plenty of physical exercise because i think that 's good for your mental health as well as everything else .
but most of all , i am the prime minister of our country and i am spending every ounce of energy , i am dedicating every fibre of my being to try to ensure that this country flourishes .
jones : good on you and good luck .
[ trumpet blown . ]
what is it with the sunnies ?
somewhere , an eyewear company is very pleased .
â¯\ ( ã ) /â¯ ( @ courtwhip ) internet , you delivered and i love you .
jones : yeah , i mean , you 're always up for a fight .
have you spoken to these dissidents ?
abbott : i talk to my colleagues all the time , that 's what you 'd expect a leader to do , i 'm constantly talking to my colleagues .
i do n't know who these so-called dissidents are , alan ; i just know that if people have got a criticism , i encourage them to call me up and we 'd talk about it .
which is strange , if the prime minister does not know who the dissidents are .
cos ' they have been on national television every day this week .
andrew laming , warren entsch , mal brough , arthur sinodinos , dennis jensen , teresa gambaro and now sharman stone .
jones : the media seem to have a preoccupation with you they 've had this since you became opposition leader .
it does seem as though it would n't matter what you did , you get a bit of grudging praise .
everyone 's talking about tuesday .
does a spill worry you ?
they need 52 votes to get a spill .
abbott : i 'm not expecting it ; i 'm expecting business as usual because this is a government with a very full agenda .
sorry , i 'm still obsessing about the alan jones interview with the pm .
here is a little more of it .
alan jones : is the medicare thing in many ways a metaphor of the problems we face ?
i mean , you 've said over and over again we 've got to set a price signal .
the co-payment which you 're talking about was policy under bob hawke .
medicare $ 8.5bn 10 years ago ; this year $ 20bn ; in a decade $ 34bn .
even peter costello said the other day , you ca n't go to an accountant for nothing or a lawyer for nothing or a dentist for nothing , why do you go to a doctor ?
that 's a metaphor of the problem , is n't it ?
tony abbott : well , alan , we 've long had price signals for the pbs .
if you or i go and get something from the pharmacist¦ jones : 36 bucks .
abbott : ¦ it 's almost $ 40 jones : yeah .
david uren , the economics writer for the oz , has examined the details around the 1.5 % levy which was supposed to have paid for the prime minister 's now defunct paid parental leave scheme .
now that the ppl is a dead parrot , big biz wants the levy to go .

here is david : the coalition is moving towards the introduction of a two-tiered corporate tax system for the first time in 40 years after social services minister scott morrison confirmed the levy designed to fund the now-abandoned paid parental leave scheme would not be â­redirected to childcare .

the australian understands the proposed ppl levy of 1.5 % , which would have been paid by the nation 's 3000 biggest companies , will be dropped but the government will revoke a promised cut in the corporate tax rate from 30 per cent to 28.5 % to ensure there is no impact on the federal budget .
small companies outside the top 3000 will still see a cut in their corporate tax rate to at least 28.5 per cent , creating a two-tiered corporate tax structure last seen between 1948 and 1972 .
here is joe hockey 's reply when asked about the story .

no , the fact is that as we said at the last election , we were going to have a levy - we were going to reduce tax to 28.5 % for all companies , and then have a levy on the largest businesses to help to pay for paid parental leave .
that was a double tax rate system , two tax levels obviously , flowing through to business , but business was not going to pay any more tax overall and that remains our commitment .

as we reported yesterday , the nationals are not happy about the possibility of a new , more progressive leader of the liberals , who might move on issues like carbon trading , gay marriage or asylum seeker policies .
while malcolm turnbull has said he will not to go back to an emissions trading scheme , the nats have been flexing their muscles .
sid maher at the australian has done a wrap here .
labor 's penny wong is not impressed .
senator penny wong ( @ senatorwong ) so nats are reportedly demanding written commitments from turnbull , inc no gay marriage or ets .
the troglodyte tail wags the coalition dog .
joe hockey is up now at a child care centre in padstow , where he read a story to potential new voters .
the theme is childcare costs ( we hear your pain ) and the prime minister 's planned families package which he will discuss well in advance of the budget .
geddit ?

it is a fact that what has changed most dramatically over the last two decades in australia is that you can really no longer afford to live in a major city in australia and pay a mortgage with just one income .
you need two incomes .

in order to help families , and under tony abbott , we are absolutely focused on a new families package that we will discuss it with the electorate and importantly build it into our budget for australia 's future .
there will be no spill motion , says hockey .
the only numbers i am worried about are the budget numbers .
what advice do you have for those contemplating a spill motion ?
bishop : i do n't have advice to my colleagues because they are elected members of parliament and they will take whatever action they see fit , but my overall message is this : we are a united team
q : have you told malcolm turnbull you would be happy to serve as pm ?
julie bishop : malcolm and i have not had that conversation .
jbish , christopher pyne and simon birmingham are up now at st peter 's girls school , the foreign ministers alma mater .
i 'm very proud to be back at my old school as a head girl many decades ago .
you could n't make this stuff up .
back to songs , the major nomination : should i stay or should i go .
the clash asks the same question as the party room .

# backtobasefriday alan jones to tony abbott : but yesterday , while you were being belted up from one end of the country to the other , bill shorten was on television getting hairs on his chest saying that labor had a fantastic record when it came to national security .
is n't the first instrument of national security economic growth and if you undermine a nation 's economic strength , you undermine its currency , your undermining national security ?
tony abbott : in the end , alan , it does all depend upon a strong economy and that 's why i 've been saying until i was blue in the face
contender julie bishop will appear with afore-mentioned christopher pyne at a school in adelaide .
stick with us .
michelle grattan in the conversation has made a call on the leadership issue .
that is not a phone call , but an analysis call .
that is , tony abbott needs to step down .
here is a taste : so let 's put aside the impossible job of prediction , and consider what might be best for the party .
this rests on a judgement about whether abbott can revive sufficiently for the government to be competitive or better at next year 's election .
it 's hard to see it .
if abbott survives in the short term , it 's quite likely he 'll be kicked out later .
if the party baulked at execution , on present indications the voters would undertake the task .

we know leaders can rebuild but there is such an entrenched view of abbott among voters that , on the balance of probabilities , he ca n't climb back just as it was clear well out from the 2013 election that julia gillard could n't .
in these circumstances , the best option would be an orderly leadership transition , with abbott stepping down .
there was a little compliment for paul keating .

alan jones : i mean , the unpopular thing is telling people , is n't it , and it 's hard and no prime minister has had to do this , i guess , since paul keating that we ca n't go on the way we 're going on where the cost of serving the labor debt and running the country is $ 110 million a day borrowed money .

tony abbott : that 's right , alan , and the point i make to all other parties and individuals in the parliament is if you do n't like what this government is proposing , tell us what you propose and , at the moment , all we 've got from the labor party is this chorus of complaint .
now , we 're seeing in victoria where i am at the moment what happens when you elect an inexperienced , unprepared labor government .
they 're just about to cancel the contract to build the east west link even though it 's going to cost them more than $ 1 billion not to build a road .
now , this is surely the midsummer of madness¦ alan jones : unbelievable , is n't it ?
back to the alan jones interview .
as always , the questions are just as instructive as the answers .
alan jones : just on one issue of criticism , this is a hell of a record .

i mean , you made this point on monday in the speech : the jobs growth in 2014 , triple the rate of 2013 4,000 new jobs a week new housing approvals at record levels , the registration of new companies the highest on record .
as well as the boats and the carbon tax and the mining tax , i mean , you know , without being self-indulgent , it 's not a bad effort .
tony abbott : and look , if you look at the other factors , there are a lot of grounds for optimism , alan .
and then there 's the kinks .
my monday , my tuesday , my wednesday the paper boy 's been , and that news looks so black there ai n't time to read it cause you might get the sack
here , i just revert to robert smith of the cure .
showing my age .
i do n't care if monday 's black tuesday , wednesday heart attack thursday never looking back it 's friday i 'm in love
i 'm getting on with the job of government .

oliver milman ( @ olliemilman ) timber yard employee asks for selfie with pm wearing his sunglasses q : you talk about the chaos under labor , do you think it 's worth to bring on a spill to end this current crisis ?
the prime minister : as i said , i 'm getting on with government .
you might be distracted - if i may say so .
but i 'm not .
you might be talking about what you 're talking about but i 'm not .
i 'm getting on with government and every daythat 's exactly what i 've beendoing .

the plan at the national press club on monday , what we 're doing for child care on tuesday , improving national security on wednesday , new laws to protect our people and keep them safe on thursday and today a tax cut for small business .
friday i 'm in love .
have you spoken to christopher pyne ?

i 've spoken to all my colleagues all the time and we talk about what we can do to improve our country and whenever i talk to christopher pyne , i talk about the importance of making our universities and other higher education institutions world class , says abbott .
abbott rattles off all the things he has done every day this week .
he 's getting on with the job .

we were elected to fix labor 's mess , to build a strong and prosperous economy for a safe and secure australia and that 's exactly what we do every day including next monday , next tuesday , next wednesday , next thursday , next friday .
i speak to all my colleagues all the time .
tony abbott refuses to answer the reports that he had a sit down private meeting with malcolm turnbull this week to thrash things out .
he talks to colleagues all the time , he says , but he does not report private conversations .
tony abbott says he rang his colleagues after the christmas break to say : how 's it going .
tony abbott is whacking the victorian labor government for losing $ 1bn by rejecting the east west link project .
the former liberal government locked in the $ 1bn compensation clause in the road contract after labor announced they did not support it .
asked about the wisdom of a liberal state government locking in the compensation , abbott said : the former government wanted to get the road built .
the coalition government in victoria and the coalition government in canberra were working together to get the road built because melbourne needs the road .
i came out here this morning and even at 9:00 in the morning there was a massive logjam of vehicles at hoddle street .
tony abbott has turned up in melbourne to talk about the removal of the carbon tax and the dodgy decisions of the victorian labor government .
by happy coincidence , he may be able to drop in on influential victorian liberals like peter costello and jeff kennett , who have moved on and michael kroger , who was looking wobbly last night .
abbott is doing a doorstop right now .
trains have been so much a part of this week , what with malcolm turnbull 's tweeting train trip on the way to the damn dam hotel last night .
it turns out another key liberal backbencher sharman stone was actually trapped on a train last night , forced well past her stop at euroa in country victoria .
sharman stone mp ( @ sharmanstone ) oops , train to euroa , but door jammed so carried on to violet town !
vline to get us all back to euroa .
same happened last night !
# netrains as a result , the poor woman had to get off at the next town - violet town - and catch a cab back at presumably great expense to her destination .
sharman stone mp ( @ sharmanstone ) finally back to euroa by taxi an hour later .
met the great local volunteers who unlock the toilets for the station ! !
stone is interesting for many different reasons .

you will remember she is the liberal member for murray who was caught by the spc-ardmona decision when the federal government refused assistance to the company , just after throwing some dosh to cadbury before the election .
the corresponding spc bunfight was tricky because her electorate cuddles up to the absent-minded voters of indi - who supported independent cathy mcgowan .
stone has tiptoed out with the dissenters and suggested the leadership issue should not drag on .
daniel hurst reports : the liberal mp sharman stone said the leadership issue can not be allowed to drag on and dribble on and must be resolved at the party room meeting next week .

stone , who represents murray in victoria and had a public dispute with the cabinet last year over support for spc ardmona , said ideally abbott would allow a vote on the party 's confidence in the leader , which could prompt a spill .
a change of leadership , or a vote to keep abbott , would allow the party to get back to the business of governing this country .
we 've got to resolve it ¦ i think we 've got to have this resolved .
if tony gets through this then , right , we 've got to get behind tony .
if someone else does , right , that 's our leader and we get behind that person and we diminish the prospect of having labor back in because that would be totally catastrophic .

stone declined to say which alternative leader she would support and , when asked whether she would consider moving the spill motion herself , said : i think there 'll be a lot of conversations over the weekend about this .
my key point is that we ca n't let this go on .
it 's destructive and we only have 18 months to the next election which is not long at all ; we have only weeks to the new south wales election .
the people of australia are sick to death of this introspection when there are very important , significant issues in constituencies like mine .
the polls show the australian people have moved on while bill shorten and labor are also moving into a post-abbott world .
shorten has been honing his zingers for a malcolm turnbull-led coalition government .

malcolm turnbull may have a nicer suit than tony abbott but when it comes to cost of living pressures and cutting a billion dollars from child care , malcolm turnbull and tony abbott are cut from the same cloth .
when a political leader is in trouble , they head back to their base .
the farming/mining stoush notwithstanding , tony abbott 's base is held in the hands of 2gb 's alan jones .
this morning , as his political colleagues were presumably finding other compelling things to do , abbott conducted an instructive interview with his true friend alan jones .
the hit parade of messages included : debt and deficit - i 'm just trying to do the right thing ( while others are white-anting ) .
i 'm in touch .
i talk to the australian people regularly - ( including via a weekly podcast ) .
i 'm hopeless at blowing my own trumpet .
( but seeing as you asked , i 'm a lover not a fighter . )

foreign ownership - we have n't carried out our policy to bring the foreign investment review board ( firb ) land value trigger down from $ 248m to $ 15m because we were negotiating those chinese/korean/japanese people on the free trade agreements .
now that those countries are not listening anymore , we promise to get back to that .
now obviously that is my characterisation .
i will bring you the direct quotes shortly .
just on christopher pyne 's earlier coffee-deprived comments on the numbers being an inexact science , he did not use the sky interview to make it clear that tony abbott did have the numbers .
so as it stands , the leader of the house of representatives , still believes that tony abbott may not have the numbers to survive .

not to put too fine a point on it , the leader of the house is responsible for liaising with all government members to smooth the passage of the legislation through the parliament and ensure the government agenda is on track .
he has all of their phone numbers = he knows stuff .

documents.title: pyne does not believe there will be a spill motion
text: christopher pyne mopping up .
i do n't believe there will be a spill motion .
pyne is asked about reports that three unnamed ministers believe there is going to be a spill .
he says we are getting on with the job .
it appears he would like us to understand it was a momentarily lapse .
or rather , he was just tired as the today appearance was at 6am .
christopher pyne : i do n't believe there should be a spill i do n't believe tony abbott should be replaced as leader .
we should get on with the job for a positive conservative agenda .
i am leader of the house and minister of education and i am doing the best thing for students and parents .
the media have totally over reacted to my comments .
my remarks were in no way designed to kick things along .
christopher pyne is clearing up any misinterpretation from the today show now .
for those who were not watching malcolm turnbull 's performance last night , bridie jabour has the full story here but here is the top line .

malcolm turnbull has refused to say if he would put his hand up for leadership of the liberal party if it was declared open , and insisted it was not senior members of the liberal party who were undermining tony abbott .
speaking at a politics in the pub event in wyong on the nsw central coast , turnbull said the prime minister had the support of the party room .
i 've been leader of the liberal party i know what it 's like to be leader of the liberal party , he said .
tony abbott has the support of his members .
tony has had utter loyalty and consistency from his frontbench , he 's had more loyalty and consistency from his frontbench than any other liberal leader in a long time .
there is no tension between tony and any of his senior colleagues , we are a very , very cohesive team and we are all supporting him .
he is not being undermined by anyone , any of his senior colleagues whatsoever .
it 's a very very united team .

documents.title: christopher pyne admits tony 's abbott may not survive
text: christopher pyne is the leader of the house and the education minister .
he also has the keenest political nose in the government , in my opinion , as well as a ticket to the tony abbott leadership group .
essentially , he is the liberal equivalent to labor 's anthony albanese , who in the last government was a kevin rudd backer , while serving in julia gillard 's government .
when the numbers shifted , albo shifted to take up his place while his colleagues went down with their respective leadership candidates .
as my gallery colleague laura tingle wrote at the time , albo was dancing between raindrops .
that makes pyne the one to watch when it comes to the outcome .
here he is from his regular spot on the today show , appearing with albo , of course .
i assume that the party room knows that the worst thing we could possibly do is change leadership right now .
we have to support the pm .
i 've been supporting him very strongly in the past 10 days while this has been going on .
i have been doing as much media as i possibly can , as i am this morning , because i believe that he remains the best person to be leader of the party .
q : but does he have the numbers ?
that is a very inexact science but i hope he does , yes .
pyne has his dancing shoes on .
good morning blogsters , if you have been following this space yesterday up until the malcolm turnbull show at the damn dam hotel , i officially offer you a certificate to the political wonks club .
the mad events of yesterday can be found here .

we are a small but driven club and we shall continue to to bring you all of the breaking news on tony abbott 's prime ministership as the leadership spill boils over ahead of the first liberal party room meeting since the christmas break on tuesday .
there is so much around this morning which i will bring you shortly .
join the conversation on twitter with me @ twitterid .

bulletin.text: Prime minister addresses issue after WA Liberal MP Luke Simpkins moves to bring a leadership vote against the PM. Follow updates live.
